newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper called to open slightly firmer.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper called to open slightly firmer.

text.p: COMEX copper futures were called to open slightly firmer Thursday in line with barely changed LME copper prices overnight.
Wednesday, the market continued to correct as the end to continued falls in LME stocks and the lack of news made it difficult to sustain upward momentum, dealers said.
COMEX July copper was called up 0.10 to 0.30 cent from Wednesday's close at 115.65 cents a lb.
LME warehouse copper stocks rose just 250 tonnes to 132,800 tonnes in Thursday's data, while COMEX copper stocks fell 266 short tons Wednesday to 42,129 short tons.
On ACCESS, July copper last traded at 116.10 cents, up 0.45 cent from Wednesday's close.
